data.title: NCSF Awards 2022 — The National Cyber Scholarship Foundation
data.meta_description: Listed here are the students from each state who were ranked as Scholars in the 2022 National Cyber Scholarship program.
data.text:
Finalists & Scholars 2022

Listed here are the students from each state who were ranked as Finalists and Scholars in the 2022 National Cyber Scholarship program.

What does each rank mean?

Scholar with Honors: Scholars from 2022 who went on to complete the Cyber Foundations Academy and achieve a high score on the GFACT certification exam, and were awarded the $500 Alan Paller Honor Scholarship. A full list of the 2022 National Cyber Scholars with Honors can be found here.

Scholar: The top 1152 highest scoring students who met the eligibility criteria for a Scholarship (including being in 11th-12th grade or enrolled in an accredited U.S. college), who have each been awarded free access to this summer’s Cyber Foundations Academy and a digital Scholar badge.

Finalist: The highest scoring 2325 students who completed the NCSF Scholarship Application, who will each be awarded a digital Finalist badge.

Semifinalist: The 4521 students who scored at least 20,000 points in CyberStart via CyberStart America or Cyber FastTrack, 1000 points in picoCTF, or Platinum level in CyberPatriot.

The highest rank achieved by each student is listed here, but each rank also includes the awards issued to the lower ranks, i.e. the total number of listed Finalists includes those ranked as Scholars.

Note: if a student is listed as “Anonymous”, they have chosen to not have their name published in this list.
